DataElement.preferredName: Breast Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for questions addressing abnormal conditions of the breast in order to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Breast Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.

Property.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have histologica
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed invasive adenocarcinoma of the breast (HER2-negative) that is locally advanced/metastatic and has progressed despite standard therapy; at least 1 prior chemotherapy regimen in the metastatic setting, and two lines of hormonal therapy (administered in the adjuvant or metastatic setting) for patients with hormone receptor-positive disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has breast cancer, does patient have either estrogen receptor positive and HER2 negative breast cancer OR Triple negative breast cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of triple negative breast cancer, was adjuvant chemotherapy completed more than 3 years prior to registration and patient remains free of recurrent or metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient's disease,  ER and PR less than Allred score of 3 or less than or equal to  5% positive staining cells in the invasive component of the tumor (provided the patient is being treated as triple negative breast cancer)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: If breast cancer patient is registered to the disease specific expansion cohort, does patient have metastatic or advanced (incurable and unresectable) HER2 negative breast cancer regardless of estrogen receptor status (both hormone receptor positive and triple negative patients are eligible) and has patient received hormonal therapy as appropriate based on their hormone receptor status?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed ER and/or PR positive, HER2 negative or non-amplified breast cancer that is stage IV, with measurable or non-measurable disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has metastatic breast cancer and BRCA mutation, has patient received specific PARP inhibitor therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of localized triple negative breast cancer or localized resected cancer, was adjuvant chemotherapy completed more than 3 years prior to registration and patient remains free of recurrent or metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a history of localized triple negative breast cancer, was adjuvant chemotherapy completed more than three years prior to registration, and the patient remains free of recurrent or metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient a postmenopausal woman or man with estrogen receptor positive (ER+), human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 (HER2) negative metastatic breast cancer (MBC)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient's disease, ER and /or PR positive, defined with at least 1% positive staining cells in the invasive component of the tumor or an Allred score of at least  3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have HER2-negative breast cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have metastatic or unresectable carcinoma of the breast that is estrogen receptor (ER) negative (less than 10%), progesterone receptor (PR) negative (less than 10%), and HER2 negative/unamplified?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have HER2 1-3+ expression by IHC OR HER2 amplification by next generation sequencing panel (NGS) or in situ hybridization (ISH) OR If local testing is not feasible, is archival tissue available for central HER2 testing to determine eligibility?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have non-metastatic, histologically confirmed primary ER less than or equal to 10%, PR less than or equal to 10%, and HER2-negative breast cancer (TNBC) either using the baseline biopsy specimen or the post-NAC residual surgical specimen and RCB2 or RCB3, as defined by Symmans et al., 2007, and received neoadjuvant anthracycline and/or taxane-based chemotherapy or non-metastatic, histologically confirmed primary ER greater than 10% and/or PR greater than 10%, HER2-negative breast cancer with RCB3 and received neoadjuvant anthracycline and/or taxane-based chemotherapy or locoregionally recurrent TNBC or ER greater than 10% and/or PR greater than 10%, HER2-negative breast cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has tumors where anti-HER2 therapy is standard of care, has patient progressed on at least 1 line of anti-HER2 therapy if eligible?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has breast cancer, does patient have a prior history of hormone receptor positivity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically confirmed mTN-IBC, (TNBC is defined as less than 10% estrogen receptor and progesterone receptor expression by immunohistochemistry (IHC) and Negative or 1+ for HER2 by IHC or negative by fluorescent in situ hybridization based on ASCO/CAP guideline)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is ER, PR and HER2 status unknown?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 19
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has metastatic breast cancer, does patient have germline mutation, no somatic mutation and has had had prior chemo (adj, treatment); or if HR+, must have had prior endocrine therapy or deemed inappropriate for endocrine treatment?

DataElement.changeDescription: 8/26/15 approved and released. tt_8/25/15 edit to classification/tt_8/21/15 Protocol 9844 tt.
